alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pulaski, Floyd and northeastern Carroll Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Alum Ridge, or near Indian Valley, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Floyd... Indian Valley... Willis... Allisonia... Mabry Mill... Alum Ridge... and Copper Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central and northwestern North Carolina...south central, southwestern and west central Virginia...and southeastern West Virginia.
